# Introduction

Zotero is a free, open-source tool for managing references and bibliographies.  

![](images/zotero-logo.svg){fig-align="center" width="40%"}

---

# Installing Zotero

1. Go to the [Zotero website](https://www.zotero.org/).
2. Download the desktop app for your operating system.
*Optional*
3. Install the **Zotero Connector** for your browser.


---

# Setting Up Your Library

Zotero libraries can be organized with folders (called *Collections*) and tags.  
You can also sync your library across devices by creating a free Zotero account.

<!-- ![](images/zotero-library.png){fig-align="center" width="90%"} -->

---

# Adding References

You can add references in several ways:

- **Browser Connector**: Save references directly from your web browser.  
- **DOI/ISBN Lookup**: Paste a DOI or ISBN into Zotero.  
- **Manual Entry**: Add details yourself.  

<!-- ![](images/zotero-add-item.png){fig-align="center" width="60%"} -->

---

# Using Zotero with Word

Zotero installs a plugin that allows you to insert citations and bibliographies into your documents.  

1. Open Word or LibreOffice.  
2. Look for the **Zotero** tab in the toolbar.  
3. Insert citations as you write.

<!-- ![](images/zotero-word-plugin.png){fig-align="center" width="80%"} -->
